Package infodynamics.measures.continuous

Interface ActiveInfoStorageCalculatorMultiVariate

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ActiveInfoStorageCalculator, EmpiricalNullDistributionComputer, InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ActiveInfoStorageCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian, ActiveInfoStorageCalculatorMultiVariateKernel, ActiveInfoStorageCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov, ActiveInfoStorageCalculatorMultiVariateViaMutualInfo
    public interface ActiveInfoStorageCalculatorMultiVariate
extends ActiveInfoStorageCalculator
    Interface for implementations of Active Information Storage estimators on multivariate continuous time-series data. That is, it is applied to double[][] data, indexed first by time then by variable number.

    See definition of Active Information Storage (AIS) by Lizier et al. below. Basically, AIS is the mutual information between the past state of a time-series process X and its next value. The past state at time n is represented by an embedding vector of k values from X_n backwards, each separated by \tau steps, giving X^k_n = [ X_{n-(k-1)\tau}, ... , X_{n-\tau}, X_n]. We call k the embedding dimension, and \tau the embedding delay. AIS is then the mutual information between X^k_n and X_{n+1}.

    Usage of the child classes implementing this interface is intended to follow this paradigm:

    1. Construct the calculator;
    2. Set properties using ActiveInfoStorageCalculator.setProperty(String, String);
    3. Initialise the calculator using ActiveInfoStorageCalculator.initialise(int) or ActiveInfoStorageCalculator.initialise(int, int) or initialise(int, int, int);
    4. Provide the observations/samples for the calculator to set up the PDFs, using:
      • setObservations(double[][]) for calculations based on single time-series, OR
      • The following sequence:
        1. ActiveInfoStorageCalculator.startAddObservations(), then
        2. One or more calls to addObservations(double[][]) or addObservations(double[][], int, int), then
        3. ActiveInfoStorageCalculator.finaliseAddObservations(); OR
      • univariate calls as supported by ActiveInfoStorageCalculator
    5. Compute the required quantities, being one or more of:
      • the average AIS: InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous.computeAverageLocalOfObservations();
      • the local AIS values for these samples: ActiveInfoStorageCalculator.computeLocalOfPreviousObservations()
      • local AIS values for a specific set of samples: computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations(double[])
      • the distribution of AIS values under the null hypothesis of no relationship between past sequences in the series and the next value: EmpiricalNullDistributionComputer.computeSignificance(int) or EmpiricalNullDistributionComputer.computeSignificance(int[][]).
    6. Return to step 2 or 3 to re-use the calculator on a new data set.

    References:

    • J.T. Lizier, M. Prokopenko and A.Y. Zomaya, "Local measures of information storage in complex distributed computation", Information Sciences, vol. 208, pp. 39-54, 2012.
    Author:
    Pedro AM Mediano (email, www), Joseph Lizier (email, www)
    See Also:
    ActiveInfoStorageCalculator

    • Method Detail

      • initialise

        void initialise​(int dimensions,
                int k,
                int tau)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        Initialise the calculator for re-use with new observations. History length k, source and destination dimensions are specified here; all other parameters remain unchanged.
        Parameters:
        dimensions - number of joint variables in the system.
        k - history embedding length to be considered.
        tau - history embedding delay to be considered.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setObservations

        void setObservations​(double[] observations)
              throws java.lang.Exception

        Sets a single set of univariate observations to compute the PDFs from. Can only be called on this multivariate calculator if the dimension of the system is 1, otherwise throws an exception

        Sets a single time-series from which to compute the PDF for the AIS. Cannot be called in conjunction with other methods for setting/adding observations.
        Specified by:
        setObservations in interface ActiveInfoStorageCalculator
        Parameters:
        observations - time-series array of (univariate) samples, where the array index is time.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if initialised dimensions were not 1

        void addObservations​(double[] observations)
              throws java.lang.Exception

        Adds a new set of univariate observations to compute the PDFs from. Can only be called on this multivariate calculator if the dimension of the system is 1, otherwise throws an exception

        Add more time-series for the computation of the PDF. The array observations must not be over-written by the user until after finaliseAddObservations() has been called.

                     int startTime,

              throws java.lang.Exception
        This method will return an exception if this class was not initialised for univariate data only. Add more time-series for the computation of the PDF, using only a sub-series of observations. The array observations must not be over-written by the user until after finaliseAddObservations() has been called.

        Parameters:
        observations - time-series array of (univariate) samples, where the array index is time.
        startTime - first time index to extract samples from
        numTimeSteps - number of time steps to extract starting from startTime

      • setObservations

        void setObservations​(double[] observations,
                     boolean[] valid)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        This method will return an exception if this class was not initialised for univariate data only. Sets a single time-series from which to compute the PDF for the AIS, subject to the validity of each sample in that series. Cannot be called in conjunction with other methods for setting/adding observations.
        Specified by:
        setObservations in interface ActiveInfoStorageCalculator
        Parameters:
        observations - time-series array of (univariate) samples, where the array index is time.
        valid - a time series (with indices the same as observations) indicating whether the entry in observations at that index is valid; we only take vectors as samples to add to the observation set where all points in the time series (even between points in the embedded k-vector with embedding delays) are valid.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if initialised dimensions were not 1

      • computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations

        double[] computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations​(double[] newObservations)
                                        throws java.lang.Exception
        This method will return an exception if this class was not initialised for univariate data only. Compute the local AIS values for each of the supplied samples in newObservations.

        PDFs are computed using all of the previously supplied observations, but not those in newObservations (unless they were some of the previously supplied samples).

        Specified by:
        computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations in interface ActiveInfoStorageCalculator
        Parameters:
        newObservations - time-series for which to compute local AIS values
        Returns:
        time-series of local AIS values corresponding to newObservations (the first (k-1)*tau + 1 values are set to 0 since AIS is undefined there)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if initialised dimensions were not 1

      • computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations

        double[] computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations​(double[][] newObservations)
                                        throws java.lang.Exception
        As per computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations(double[]) only with multivariate observations
        Parameters:
        newObservations - time-series array of (multivariate) samples, where the first index is time.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
